summary: A "press agency" refers to an organization that gathers, produces, and distributes news and information to various media outlets. Within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, press agencies play a crucial role in ensuring the dissemination of information related to EU policies, legislation, and public affairs. They facilitate transparency and accountability by providing timely and accurate reporting on EU activities. Furthermore, press agencies often collaborate with EU institutions to enhance public engagement and inform citizens about EU matters. Their operations are subject to regulatory oversight to ensure compliance with media laws and standards, promoting ethical journalism across member states.
